intro: Mappia ampla, commonly known as the broadleaf mappia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its fibrous roots and woody stems make it a valuable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
